name: fecundity
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the ability to produce a lot of crops, fruit, babies, young animals, etc.: female fecundity This part of the state is a lush land of great fecundity.
the fact of producing or creating a lot of new things, ideas, etc.: The play is yet another representation of his creative fecundity. The work combines a fecundity of imagination and a richness of poetical expression. See
fecund
More examplesFewer examplesIn some species, fecundity rises with increasing age in the female.The study is based on 10,000 marriages, showing the average fecundity of both sexes for different ages.She has displayed remarkable literary fecundity, producing more than 20 books in three years.
